SEARCH
Package controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
The GameController class manages the game logic and flow.(CONTROLLER)

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(int NumPlayers, Server serverCreator, String creatorLobby)
      Constructs a new GameController instance with the specified number of players, server, and creator lobby.
      Parameters:
      NumPlayers - the number of players in the game.
      serverCreator - the server associated with the game.
      creatorLobby - the creator lobby of the game.

    • GameController

      public GameController(int NumPlayers, Server serverCreator)
      Constructs a new GameController instance with the specified number of players and server.
      Parameters:
      NumPlayers - the number of players in the game.
      serverCreator - the server associated with the game.

      Retrieves the ID of the object.

      Sets the end value.
      Parameters:

    • getEnd

      public int getEnd()
      Retrieves the end value.
      Returns:
      the end value.

    • createPlayer

      public void createPlayer(int id_new, String np)
      Creates a new player with the specified ID and player name, and adds it to the current game. If the number of players reaches the specified total number of players, the game is started.
      Parameters:
      id_new - the ID of the new player.
      np - the name of the new player.

    • getNumPlayers

      public int getNumPlayers()
      Retrieves the total number of players in the game.
      Returns:
      the total number of players.

    • getPlayersFilled

      public int getPlayersFilled()
      Retrieves the number of players currently filled in the game.
      Returns:
      the number of players currently filled.

    • getPlayersList

      public List<Player> getPlayersList()
      Retrieves the list of players in the current game.
      Returns:
      the list of players in the current game.

    • getCommonGoals

      public List<CommonGoals> getCommonGoals()
      Retrieves the list of common goals in the current game.
      Returns:
      the list of common goals in the current game.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the game is full, i.e., if the number of players equals the specified total number of players.
      Returns:
      true if the game is full, false otherwise.

    • somethingChanged

      public void somethingChanged()
      Notifies the server that something has changed in the game. It sends a message to the server with the updated information.

    • started

      public void started()
      Starts the game by setting the first player and checking for uniques names conditions. Determines the starting player based on the number of players and their unique names. Sends a game starting message to the server if the starting conditions are met.

    • ended

      public void ended()
      Ends the game by setting the end flag, sending a game ending message to the server, and updating the end status locally. This method is called when the game has ended and no further actions can be taken.

    • changeName

      public void changeName(int id, String name)
      Changes the name of a player identified by the specified ID. Updates the player's name in the current game. If the number of players in the game is equal to the specified total number of players, the game is started.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the player to change the name for
      name - the new name for the player

    • finderPlayer

      public int finderPlayer(String name)
      Finds the player with the specified name and returns their ID.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player to find
      Returns:
      the ID of the player with the specified name, or 0 if not found

    • pickNextPlayer

      public void pickNextPlayer()
      Modifies and picks the next player when the current player has finished their turn. - Checks if the old current player has completed some common goals. - Checks if the current player's shelf is completed. - Sets last round status for players who can no longer play. - Handles the end of the game and calculates final points. - Updates the current player to the next player in the list. - Notifies of the change in the game state.

    • playerTurn

      public Player playerTurn()
      Returns the current player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      The current player.

    • pickTiles

      public void pickTiles(List<Integer> xCord, List<Integer> yCord)
      Picks the tiles specified by the given x and y coordinates and updates the dashboard. After picking the tiles, it proceeds to pick the next player.
      Parameters:
      xCord - The x coordinates of the tiles to pick.
      yCord - The y coordinates of the tiles to pick.

    • tileAvailablePick

      public boolean tileAvailablePick(List<Integer> yCord, List<Integer> xCord)
      Checks if the specified tiles are available for picking on the dashboard.
      Parameters:
      yCord - The y coordinates of the tiles to check.
      xCord - The x coordinates of the tiles to check.
      Returns:
      True if the tiles are available for picking, false otherwise.

    • insertTiles

      public void insertTiles(List<Integer> xCoord, List<Integer> yCoord, int column)
      Inserts the picked tiles from the dashboard into the specified column of the player's shelf.
      Parameters:
      xCoord - The x coordinates of the tiles on the dashboard to be inserted.
      yCoord - The y coordinates of the tiles on the dashboard to be inserted.
      column - The column in the player's shelf where the tiles will be inserted.

    • columnAvailable

      public boolean columnAvailable(int numTiles, Shelf myShelf, int column)
      Checks if the specified column in the player's shelf is available to insert the given number of tiles.
      Parameters:
      numTiles - The number of tiles to be inserted.
      myShelf - The player's shelf to check.
      column - The column to check for availability.
      Returns:
      true if the column is available; false otherwise.

    • checkPoints

      public void checkPoints()
      Checks and updates the points for the current player based on the completion of common goals. This method checks the first and second common goals and updates the player's points accordingly.

    • checkWinner

      public Player checkWinner()
      Checks and returns the player with the highest points, determining the winner of the game.
      Returns:
      The player with the highest points, indicating the winner.

    • getDashboardTiles

      public Tile[][] getDashboardTiles()
      Retrieves the current dashboard tiles of the game.
      Returns:
      The 2D array representing the current dashboard tiles.
